text: Another mark against McCain is that we lost Vietnam, the war that much of his current fame comes from.  We don't like to talk about the wars we lost.  In fact, we managed to forget about Vietnam so much that we started a new one less than thirty years later in Afghanistan.
author: Johngcole

text:
One really good way is to be remembered is to have some seriously successful offspring who do a lot of things.  Think Joseph P. Kennedy.

I've sized up McCain's offspring, and that ain't his ticket into the history books.
author: Johngcole

text:
This is actually a thread that would be good for @KevinMKruse  to talk about.

But seriously- what it takes to be remembered in 100 years is pretty extraordinary.  Hell, of the people you probably think are super famous right now, maybe two or three of them will be in 50 years.
author: Johngcole

text: I’m not saying this as an attack on McCain, just as a reality check on how very few people are actually remembered through history.  It’s a ridiculously small list.  You really have to have done something major.  Think of who you remember from the years 1910-1920.
author: Johngcole
